title: Two Canadian women arrested upon return from Syria
description: A lawyer for two Canadian women who just returned from Syria says they were arrested by Canada’s federal police force

title: Buenos Aires airport turns into unofficial homeless shelter
description: The Jorge Newbery International Airport in the Argentine capital has practically become a homeless shelter at night

title: Gunmen kill at least 50 in attacks on village in Nigeria
description: Authorities say at least 50 people have died after two attacks on a village in north-central Nigeria

title: Russian court delays custody decision for girl who made antiwar drawing
description: The court said it could not make a decision because it did not know the whereabouts of her father, Alexei Moskalyov, who was reportedly detained in Belarus after fleeing house arrest in Russia.

title: Protesters storm BlackRock building, clash with police over France’s pension reform
description: Strikes and protests over pension reform continued to block streets and key services in France, though the number of participants appeared to be dwindling.

title: China denies fentanyl trafficking with Mexico; blames US
description: China’s government has denied that there is any illegal fentanyl trafficking with Mexico and said it had not been notified by Mexico’s government of any seizures of the precursor chemicals used to make the powerful drug

title: Former Italian leader Silvio Berlusconi in treatment for leukemia
description: The former prime minister is in intensive care for a lung infection, and has been in treatment for leukemia "for some time," his doctors said in a statement.

title: China’s military aims to launch 13,000 satellites to rival Elon Musk’s Starlink
description: In the race for low-earth orbit dominance, Beijing is years behind SpaceX and worried about the national security threat.

title: At least 25 people abducted by gunmen in western Cameroon
description: Local authorities in Cameroon say that at least 25 people were abducted during a week of attacks by armed men in western Cameroon

title: King Charles III supports probe into monarchy's slave ties
description: King Charles III for the first time has signaled support for research into the British monarchy’s ties to slavery

title: Wildfire in southern Spain forces evacuation of 70 residents
description: Spanish authorities say that they have evacuated 70 people from their homes to ensure their safety as a wildfire burned unchecked in southern Andalusia

title: How progressive Denmark became the face of the anti-migration left
description: Danish authorities are threatening settled refugees with deportation and pushing for overseas processing centers. It may be a sign of what's to come in Europe.

title: South Korea wants school bullies outed when they apply for college or jobs
description: South Korea's ruling party plans to introduce a bill that would punish school bullies following popular Korean dramas like "The Glory."

title: Austria: 35 migrants found in trailer, driver arrested
description: Police say 35 migrants were found in the trailer of a truck in southern Austria after the vehicle was damaged and an employee at a repair workshop heard noises from inside

title: UN court says it can hear Guyana-Venezuela border dispute
description: The United Nations’ highest court has ruled that it can hear a case between South American neighbors Guyana and Venezuela about a border dispute that dates back to 1899

title: Greece to send more arms to Ukraine, but sets limits
description: Greece has pledged military assistance to Ukraine for “as long as it takes” but officials cautioned that the country needs to keep much of its Russian-made weaponry for its own defensive needs

title: China hosts rare meeting of top diplomats from Saudi Arabia and Iran
description: The meeting was the latest sign of easing tensions between between Iran and Saudi Arabia, whose enmity has fueled instability across the Middle East.

title: 9 suspects killed in shootout with South African police
description: Authorities in South Africa say nine suspected armed robbers were killed in an early-morning shootout with police

title: More than 30 civilians killed by Islamic extremists in Congo
description: A human rights organization in Congo said that more than 30 people have been killed in a string of attacks by extremist rebels in the country’s east

title: Meet the women changing the face of Brazil — by aging naturally
description: In the country that leads the world in plastic surgery, some prominent women are embracing gray hair.

title: Rockets fired from Lebanon into northern Israel as regional tensions soar
description: Air raid sirens wailed in northern Israel on Thursday afternoon as rockets were launched from across the border in southern Lebanon.

title: Ukrainian groups learn about DNA use to identify war victims
description: Ukrainian civil society and rights groups have visited an organization that uses high-tech DNA techniques to identify people who go missing in conflicts and natural disasters

title: Snake on a plane! South African pilot finds cobra under seat
description: A pilot in South Africa made a hasty emergency landing after discovering a highly venomous cobra hiding under his seat

title: Report: Croatian officials shared information on migrants
description: An independent investigative group has accused Croatian officials and police of using a clandestine WhatsApp group to share sensitive information about migrants trying to enter the country

title: France’s Macron says he can count on China’s Xi to reason with Russia
description: French President Emmanuel Macron's comments are some of the most positive from a Western leader, and stand in stark contrast to American political rhetoric.

title: Japanese army helicopter carrying 10 crew members missing
description: Japan’s coast guard says it is searching for an army helicopter carrying 10 crew members that went missing off a southern Japanese island

title: Political novice confirmed victorious in Montenegro election
description: Official results have confirmed a crushing defeat for Montenegro’s long-time leader Milo Djukanovic in a weekend presidential election

title: Protests again grip France but Macron not backing down
description: Protesters have blocked a road at Paris’ main airport and are gathering again in other French cities for another nationwide push with strikes and demonstrations to get President Emmanuel Macron to scrap contested pension reforms

title: Pope leads Holy Thursday service in Vatican basilica
description: Pope Francis has begun the first of two major Holy Thursday ceremonies

title: Forget gentle parenting and discipline your 1-year-old, psychologist says
description: French psychologist Caroline Goldman says 1-year-olds are ready to be punished with timeout, triggering a fierce debate about what counts as too strict.

title: Over 200 Russian journalists, activists demand release of WSJ reporter
description: The espionage charges leveled against detained Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich by Moscow are “preposterous and unjust,” they said in an open letter.

title: China vows 'forceful' measures after US-Taiwan meeting
description: China vowed reprisals against Taiwan Thursday after a meeting between the U_S_ House Speaker and the island’s President, saying the U_S_ was on a “wrong and dangerous road.”

title: Rockets fired from Gaza raise tension as Passover begins
description: Palestinian militants fired a barrage of rockets early Thursday, setting off air raid sirens in southern Israel, as violence erupted for the second day in a row during a sensitive period of overlapping holidays

title: Ukraine live briefing: Macron to meet Xi, says China can play ‘major role’ to end war
description: Europe is seeking to shore up ties with China, as Russian President Vladimir Putin hosts Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko in Moscow.

title: Why are the French so angry over retiring 2 years later?
description: Hundreds of thousands of people will fill the streets of France Thursday for the 11th day of nationwide resistance to a government proposal to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64

title: Saudi, Iranian FMs meet in China, signaling warming of ties
description: The foreign ministers of long-time Middle Eastern rivals Saudi Arabia and Iran have met in Beijing, taking another step toward reconciliation after seven years of tensions

title: Pakistan: Military kills 8 militants near Afghanistan border
description: Pakistan’s military says security forces have killed eight insurgents in an overnight operation at a militant hideout near the Afghan border

title: Brazil wrestles with solutions after deadly day care attack
description: Parents in this small city in southern Brazil are struggling with how to explain to their children that a man slaughtered four of their friends, while Brazilians across the country are wondering what should be done to stem an apparently systemic rise of violence in schools

title: Future of Borges estate in limbo as widow doesn't leave will
description: Rights to the works of the late Argentine author Jorge Luis Borges have fallen into limbo because his widow did not leave a will

title: Russia’s Lefortovo prison is a relic of Soviet control that never left
description: The history of the prison where 31-year-old Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich is held shows the limits of Russia’s post-Soviet reform.
